alert.note: Alert for Hooker (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 1:23AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hooker County through 130 AM MDT... At 1223 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northeast of Swan Lake, or 15 miles southwest of Mullen, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Hooker County. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 175 and 183. Highway 97 between mile markers 56 and 66. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
